intro: Nolana galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
